articles.title: Intelligence and Focus: How the Brain Tunes Out Distractions - Neuroscience News
articles.description: Researchers made a breakthrough in understanding how the brain manages to focus in noisy environments, distinguishing between enhancing relevant information and tuning out distractions.

articles.author: Vladimir Hedrih
articles.title: Prenatal cannabis exposure linked to heightened risk of ADHD symptoms - PsyPost
articles.description: A meta-analysis of over 200,000 participants found prenatal cannabis exposure significantly increases the risk of ADHD symptoms in offspring and suggests a possible risk for ASD. This highlights the need for caution regarding cannabis use during pregnancy.
articles.content: A recent meta-analytic study has explored the connection between maternal cannabis use during pregnancy and the occurrence of autism spectrum disorder (ASD) and attention deficit hyperactivity disord… [+4095 chars]

articles.author: Heena Sharma
articles.title: 5 Ways to Reduce Stroke Risk in Young People - WION
articles.description: 5 Ways to Reduce Stroke Risk in Young People
articles.content: Maintain a diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats. Limit intake of saturated and trans fats, sodium, and added sugars.

articles.author: Rugilė Žemaitytė
articles.title: Woman Refuses To Cover Her Scar After It Triggers Her Friend At The Beach, Drama Ensues - Bored Panda
The direction of theta and alpha travelling waves modulates human memory processing - Nature.com
articles.description: How does the brain support a wide range of behaviours? Mohan et al. examine how the direction of travelling waves of neural oscillations coordinates interactions between brain regions to support different functional processes in memory.
